PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mr. Timmie Walker, 7223 Mr. Vernon Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 8, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Should jitney drivers be licensed and permitted to operate, or should they be jailed?" answer reads: "In this day and time, I don't see why they should not be licensed. The reason is that in a large city like this, there are not enough cabs, and additional transportation is needed.  Also the jitney drivers are just trying to make a living."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Timmie Walker wearing dark hat, light colored sweater, and striped coat, standing in front of stone building between set of windows with light colored curtains
